alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 9:24PM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches with locally heavier accumulations possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Sheridan Foothills. In Montana, Southern Big Horn and Bighorn Canyon. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Wednesday. Heaviest snowfall expected between 3 AM and 10 AM. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Snow and blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times. Treacherous travel conditions are expected Wednesday morning, including I-90 south of Crow Agency through Sheridan county.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
